name: Jang Yoon-jeong
description: '''Jang Yoon-jeong''' ({{korean|hangul=장윤정}}, born February 16, 1980) is a South Korean [[Trot (music)|trot]] singer, commonly referred to as "The Queen of Trot". Jang debuted in 1999 and became well-known in 2004 when her single "Eomeona!" ("Oh My Goodness!") topped the charts. The song is often credited with helping re-popularize trot music in South Korea. In 2017, a [[Gallup (company)|Gallup]] poll found that Jang was the third-most popular singer in the country. She often appears on the [[Korean Broadcasting System|KBS]] 1TV '[[Golden Oldies (TV program)|Golden Oldies]] ({{langx|ko|가요무대}})', as well as other singing programmes.
